1.verse: The Song of Songs, which is Solomon's.

2.verse: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth!

4.verse: Draw me after you; let us run.

5.verse: I am very dark, but lovely,

6.verse: Do not gaze at me because I am dark,

7.verse: Tell me, you whom my soul loves,

10.verse: Your cheeks are lovely with ornaments,

11.verse: We will make for you ornaments of gold,

12.verse: While the king was on his couch,

13.verse: My beloved is to me a sachet of myrrh

14.verse: My beloved is to me a cluster of henna blossoms

15.verse: Behold, you are beautiful, my love;

16.verse: Behold, you are beautiful, my beloved, truly delightful.

17.verse: the beams of our house are cedar;

1.verse: I am a rose of Sharon,

3.verse: As an apple tree among the trees of the forest,

4.verse: He brought me to the banqueting house,

6.verse: His left hand is under my head,

7.verse: I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem,

9.verse: My beloved is like a gazelle

10.verse: My beloved speaks and says to me:

11.verse: for behold, the winter is past;

12.verse: The flowers appear on the earth,

13.verse: The fig tree ripens its figs,

14.verse: O my dove, in the clefts of the rock,

16.verse: My beloved is mine, and I am his;

2.verse: I will rise now and go about the city,

5.verse: I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem,

6.verse: What is that coming up from the wilderness

7.verse: Behold, it is the litter of Solomon!

9.verse: King Solomon made himself a carriage

10.verse: He made its posts of silver,

11.verse: Go out, O daughters of Zion,

1.verse: Behold, you are beautiful, my love,

2.verse: Your teeth are like a flock of shorn ewes

3.verse: Your lips are like a scarlet thread,

4.verse: Your neck is like the tower of David,

5.verse: Your two breasts are like two fawns,

7.verse: You are altogether beautiful, my love;

8.verse: Come with me from Lebanon, my bride;

9.verse: You have captivated my heart, my sister, my bride;

10.verse: How beautiful is your love, my sister, my bride!

11.verse: Your lips drip nectar, my bride;

12.verse: A garden locked is my sister, my bride,

13.verse: Your shoots are an orchard of pomegranates

14.verse: nard and saffron, calamus and cinnamon,

15.verse: a garden fountain, a well of living water,

1.verse: I came to my garden, my sister, my bride,

2.verse: I slept, but my heart was awake.

3.verse: I had put off my garment;

4.verse: My beloved put his hand to the latch,

5.verse: I arose to open to my beloved,

8.verse: I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem,

9.verse: What is your beloved more than another beloved,

10.verse: My beloved is radiant and ruddy,

11.verse: His head is the finest gold;

13.verse: His cheeks are like beds of spices,

14.verse: His arms are rods of gold,

2.verse: My beloved has gone down to his garden

3.verse: I am my beloved's and my beloved is mine;

4.verse: You are beautiful as Tirzah, my love,

5.verse: Turn away your eyes from me,

6.verse: Your teeth are like a flock of ewes

7.verse: Your cheeks are like halves of a pomegranate

8.verse: There are sixty queens and eighty concubines,

9.verse: My dove, my perfect one, is the only one,

10.verse: â€œWho is this who looks down like the dawn,

11.verse: I went down to the nut orchard

12.verse: Before I was aware, my desire set me

1.verse: How beautiful are your feet in sandals,

2.verse: Your navel is a rounded bowl

3.verse: Your two breasts are like two fawns,

4.verse: Your neck is like an ivory tower.

5.verse: Your head crowns you like Carmel,

6.verse: How beautiful and pleasant you are,

7.verse: Your stature is like a palm tree,

8.verse: I say I will climb the palm tree

9.verse: and your mouth like the best wine.

12.verse: let us go out early to the vineyards

1.verse: Oh that you were like a brother to me

2.verse: I would lead you and bring you

3.verse: His left hand is under my head,

4.verse: I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem,

5.verse: Who is that coming up from the wilderness,

6.verse: Set me as a seal upon your heart,

11.verse: Solomon had a vineyard at Baal-hamon;

12.verse: My vineyard, my very own, is before me;

13.verse: O you who dwell in the gardens,
